cleaned_text: Next Level Programs of Study 1 Next Level Programs of Study (NLPS) Overview Over 150 new CTE courses are available for the 2021 -2022 school year , as part of the Office of CTE's Next Level Programs of Study initiative. Next Level Programs of Study courses will improve the quality of CTE courses through updated, more relevant standards directly aligned to postsecondary certificate programs whenever possible. The courses have also been restructured to improve the consistency of CTE course delivery . The Office of CTE encourages schools to transition to the Next Level Programs of Study courses as soon as possible for students beginning a path way because of the inherent benefits the courses provide to students . Next Level Programs of Study will provide students the opportunity to complete up to one year's worth of a postsecondary program through a four (4) course sequence. The first three cou rses of each program of study will consist of a principles course and two advanced courses required to earn CTE Concentrator status. The three courses may be taken individually or can be completed concurrently for programs that are able to offer extended t raining sessions. Beginning in the 2022 -2023 school year, each program of study will also include a capstone course that may be taken for up to 6 credits. To learn more about the Next Level Programs of Study, please visit the Indiana Governor's Workforce Cabinet NLPS resource page , including our NLPS FAQ . Next Level Programs of Study 2 NLPS Review Document Revision Date: May 28, 2021 The purpose of the NLPS Review Document is to provide educators the opportunity to view the 4 -course sequence for each Next Level Program of Study in its entirety. Individuals can also find the competencies for each course, postsecondary course alignment, and various other course informa tion. The latest version of the NLPS Review Document includes these updates : Courses available for dual credit o Dual credit availability can be found in the "Postsecondary Course Alignment" box under each course. Courses not available for dual credit are denoted in italics, courses available for dual credit are in regular font. A few courses have been identified wi th a caret symbol (^) in the Postsecondary Course Alignment box. Courses that are designated with this symbol are Vincennes University courses that are offered through Project Excel. These courses are still being reviewed to determine if they will be available for dual credit with NLPS courses. Project Excel courses that are not identified with a caret (^), have been approved for dual credit use with NLPS. The status of Project Excel courses does not prevent these courses from being offered for dual cre dit through an Early College agreement with Vincennes University. The following programs of study have been further developed : o Education Professions, Aviation Management, Cybersecurity, Networking, Diesel Technology, and Industrial Maintenance Technicia n - Mechanical. Advanced Manufacturing Technology Career Cluster Advanced Manufacturing Program of Study Industrial Automation and Robotics , Industrial Maintenance Technician - Mechanical, Industrial Maintenance Technician - Electrical NLPS Sequence Concentrator A Course Code 7103 Course Description Advanced Manufacturing Technology introduces manufacturing processes and practices used in manufacturing environments. The course also covers key electrical principles, including current, voltage, resistance, power, inductance, capacitance, and transformers, along with basic mechanical and fluid power principles. Topics include, types of production, production materials, machining and tooling, manufacturing planning, production control, an d product distribution will be covered. Students will be expected to understand the product life cycle from conception through distribution. This course also focuses on technologies used in production processes. Basic power systems, energy transfer syst ems, machine operation and control will be explored. This course will use lecture, lab, online simulation and programming to prepare students for Certified Production Technician Testing through Manufacturing Skill Standards Council (MSSC). Automation and Robotics Capstone Career Cluster Advanced Manufacturing Program of Study Industrial Automation and Robotics NLPS Sequence Capstone Course Code 7224 Course Description The Automation and Robotics Capstone course focuses on the installation, maintenance, and repair of industrial robots. Students will also learn the basics of pneumatic, electro pneumatic and hydraulic control circuits as well as the basic theory, fundamentals of digital logic, and programming of programmable logic controllers (PLCs) in a complex mechatronic system. Students will learn to identify malfunctioning robots and to apply troubleshooting strategies to identify and localize problems caused by pneumatic and hydraulic control circuits and PLC hardware. Comple ting the capstone course will provide students the opportunity to earn a postsecondary certificate and will prepare students to take nationally recognized industry certification exams. Hands -on projects and team activities will allow students to apply lea rning on the latest industry technologies. Extended work -based learning experiences and industry partnerships are highly encouraged for an authentic industry experience. Advanced Manufacturing - Industry 4.0 Capstone Career Cluster Advanced Manufacturing Program of Study Digital Manufacturing - Industry 4.0 NLPS Sequence Capstone Course Code 7222 Course Description Introduces the basic theory, operation, and programming of industrial robots and their applications through simulations and hands -on laboratory activities. Basic theory, operation, and programming of Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) will be emphasized in this course along with how automation devices may be integrated with other machines. Multiple industry standard certifications in the field of robotics and automation will be available depending on the length of the course.
